info.name: Dataspace API
info.description: Complete API collection for Dataspace Platform with Authentication, Users, Workspaces, Repositories and Data Sources management. Now featuring CASL-based permission system with workspace owner privileges, admin member roles, and private repository whitelist access control. Mission 1 & 2 complete: User-specific private repository permissions override role permissions.

item.name: Repositories
item.description: CRUD operations for repositories with workspace-based permissions. Repositories now have database types at the repository level, and can contain multiple data sources.

{
  "name": "My PostgreSQL Repository",

request.description: Creates a repository without initial data sources. The repository has a database type (POSTGRESQL, MYSQL, MONGODB, etc.) and data sources can be added later. The repositoryNameKey must contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and single dashes (max 32 characters).

Note: Private repositories use the new whitelist system - users must be explicitly granted access via the Private Repository Access endpoints.

query.description: Number of repositories to return (default: 10, max: 100)
Search across repository name and description using SQL LIKE

request.description: Gets paginated list of repositories in a specific workspace. Response includes repository type and array of data sources. Private repositories are only shown if user has explicit access or is workspace owner/admin.
Gets a specific repository by ID. Response includes repository type, all data sources, and workspace details.
Updates a repository including its database type. Note: Changing the database type affects all data sources in the repository - ensure compatibility.
Deletes a repository and all its associated data sources. The operation is cascaded - deleting the repository also removes all data sources and their change history.

item.name: Private Repository Access
item.description: Mission 1 & 2 Complete: Whitelist-based private repository access control. Individual users can be granted access to private repositories regardless of their role permissions. This system provides user-specific permissions that override role limitations.

item.name: Grant User Access to Private Repository

request.description: Mission 1: Grant a user access to a private repository. This bypasses role permissions - even if the user's role doesn't allow repository access, they will be able to access this specific private repository. The accessReason can be 'invited', 'owner', or 'admin'.

item.name: Get All Users with Access to Private Repository

request.description: Mission 2: Get all users who have access to this private repository. Returns the complete whitelist with user details, permissions, and access reasons.

item.name: Update User Permissions for Private Repository

request.description: Update a user's permissions for a specific private repository. This modifies their whitelist entry - useful for promoting/demoting access levels.

item.name: Check Specific User Access to Private Repository

request.description: Check if a specific user has access to this private repository and what permissions they have. Returns their whitelist entry or { hasAccess: false }.

item.name: Revoke User Access to Private Repository

request.description: Remove a user from the private repository whitelist. They will lose access to this private repository, regardless of their role permissions.

item.name: Data Sources
item.description: Data source management endpoints. Data sources inherit the database type from their parent repository and can be managed independently.

exec: // Extract and save the data source ID from response

request.description: Creates a new data source within a repository. The data source inherits the database type from the repository (no type field needed). Configuration is encrypted before storage.

item.name: Get All Data Sources for Repository

request.description: Gets all data sources associated with a repository. Response includes name, repositoryId, and timestamps but not configuration (use specific endpoint for configuration).
Gets a specific data source by ID. Returns basic information without configuration. Use the configuration endpoint to get decrypted configuration.
Gets the decrypted configuration for a specific data source. This endpoint returns both the data source metadata and the decrypted configuration object.
Updates a data source. Both name and configuration are optional. Changes are tracked in the change history with user attribution. Configuration is encrypted before storage.
Deletes a data source and all its associated change history. This removes the data source from the repository but doesn't affect other data sources.

query.description: Number of history records to return (default: 10, max: 100)

request.description: Gets paginated change history for a data source. Shows all modifications made to the data source including name and configuration changes with user attribution and timestamps.

item.name: Data Engine
item.description: Multi-database query execution endpoints. Execute queries, batch operations, and manage connections for various database types (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, etc.).

item.name: Test Database Connection
item.description: Test database connection with credentials only - no workspace or repository context required

item.name: Execute Query
item.description: Execute a single query on a data source. Supports parameterized queries and custom timeouts. The query format depends on the database type (SQL for PostgreSQL/MySQL, MongoDB query objects, etc.).

item.name: Execute Batch Queries
item.description: Execute multiple queries in batch on a data source. Useful for running related queries together with better performance than individual requests.

item.name: Execute Transaction (Reserved)
item.description: Execute operations within a database transaction. Currently returns an error indicating the endpoint is reserved for future implementation. Requires specific transaction operation implementation.

item.name: Get Connection Status
item.description: Get connection status for a specific data source. Returns health status, connection details, and response time metrics.

item.name: Get Repository Data Sources
item.description: Get all data sources for a repository with their connection status. Shows overview of all data sources and their health status.

item.name: Disconnect Data Source
item.description: Disconnect a specific data source connection. Useful for manually managing connection pools or closing connections.

item.name: Get Native Client Info (Admin)

response.name: Success Response

item.description: Get native database client information (admin endpoint). Returns client type and availability but not the actual client object for security reasons. Requires manage permissions on the repository.

item.name: Data Engine Admin
item.description: Administrative endpoints for data engine connection pool management. Requires elevated permissions.

item.name: Get Pool Statistics
item.description: Get connection pool statistics (admin only). Returns detailed metrics about active connections, connection types, and workspace distribution. Requires workspace manage permissions.

item.name: Admin Management
item.description: Endpoints for managing workspace admin privileges. Workspace owners and admin members can promote/demote members.

request.description: Promotes a workspace member to admin. Admin members have full access to all workspace operations, bypassing role-based permissions. Only workspace owners and existing admin members can promote others.
Revokes admin privileges from a workspace member. The member will fall back to role-based permissions. Only workspace owners and admin members can revoke admin privileges.
Get list of all supported database types with basic information (no configuration details)

query.description: Include configuration field details for each database type

request.description: Get list of all supported database types with detailed configuration information including required/optional fields, defaults, and descriptions
